intro: Sulcorebutia azurduyensis var. sormae, commonly known as the Sorma's blue bulb, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Cactaceae family and is characterized by its compact, globular shape and blue-gray foliage. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. It is a slow-growing plant that thrives in well-draining soil and full sun exposure. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable specimen in botanical collections.
